title: Benjamin Delgado
text: I grew up in Chapel Hill, NC. I studied economics and mathematics at Williams College. After that, I worked as a research analyst at the Federal Reserve Bank of Atlanta for two years, supporting Simon Fuchs and Veronika Penciakova with their work on spatial economics and firm dynamics, respectively. Currently, I am a first-year PhD student at Brown University, looking to work on issues related to health, education, and labor economics.

title: Geographic Variation in Food Prices and the Effect of Food Programs on the Well-Being of the Elderly
text: I leverage plausibly exogenous geographic variation in the real value of SNAP benefits to examine the effects of variation in SNAP purchasing power on program enrollment, health outcomes, and health care utilization among the elderly
